rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable HO.HOPRESP

datasetVariables.label: Pre-Specified Healthcare Encounter
datasetVariables.name: HOPRESP

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable HO.HOOCCUR

datasetVariables.description: Used when the occurrence of specific healthcare encounters is solicited, to indicate whether or not an encounter occurred. Values are null for spontaneously reported events.
datasetVariables.label: Healthcare Encounter Occurrence
datasetVariables.name: HOOCCUR

priorVersion.title: Start Relative to Reference Time Point

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable HO.HOSTRTPT

self.title: Start Relative to Reference Time Point

datasetVariables.description:
Identifies the start of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable --STTPT.
Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
datasetVariables.label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: HOSTRTPT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable HO.HOSTTPT

datasetVariables.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by STRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15" or "VISIT 1".
datasetVariables.label: Start Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: HOSTTPT

priorVersion.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable HO.HOENRTPT

self.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

datasetVariables.description:
Identifies the end of the event as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable HOENTPT.
Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
datasetVariables.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: HOENRTPT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable HO.HOENTPT

datasetVariables.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by HOENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25" or "VISIT 2".
datasetVariables.label: End Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: HOENTPT

description: A events domain that contains data for inpatient and outpatient healthcare events (e.g., hospitalization, nursing home stay, rehabilitation facility stay, ambulatory surgery). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C117757, 2018-06-29)
label: Healthcare Encounters
name: HO
